{"step_by_step_thinking": "Achondroplasia is an autosomal dominant disorder, which means that if one parent has the condition, there is a 50% chance of passing it on to their child. When both parents have achondroplasia, they each have a 50% chance of passing on the affected gene. However, since achondroplasia is a dominant disorder, if the child inherits the affected gene from either parent, they will have the condition. Therefore, the chances of having an unaffected baby when both parents have achondroplasia is 0%.", "answer_choice": "A"}
